intro: Penstemon exilifolius, commonly known as narrowleaf beardtongue, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of tubular, violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in open habitats such as sagebrush steppe and rocky hillsides. Penstemon exilifolius is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
